title: Add CommentSection to entity detail pages
Add comments database schema and server functions
Create CommentSection component with form and list
Implement RSS feeds
description:
Create RSS feeds for all content types.

## Individual Feeds:
- /events.rss - upcoming events
- /news.rss - news articles
- /jobs.rss - active job postings
- /companies.rss - new/updated companies
- /groups.rss - new/updated groups
- /learning.rss - new/updated learning resources
- /people.rss - new/updated people profiles

## Combined Feed:
- /feed.rss or /all.rss - everything combined, sorted by date

## Implementation:
- Create RSS generation utility
- Proper RSS 2.0 format with enclosures for images
- Include markdown content as description (or HTML rendered)
- Proper dates, GUIDs, links
close_reason: Implemented RSS feeds: combined feed (/feed.rss), events (/events.rss), news (/news.rss), jobs (/jobs.rss)

title: Add JSON REST API with OpenAPI spec
description:
Create a public JSON REST API:

Endpoints:
- GET /api/companies (list with pagination)
- GET /api/companies/:slug (single company)
- GET /api/events (list with pagination)
- GET /api/events/:slug (single event)
- GET /api/people (list with pagination)
- GET /api/people/:slug (single person)
- GET /api/news (list with pagination)
- GET /api/news/:slug (single article)
- GET /api/jobs (list with pagination)
- GET /api/jobs/:slug (single job)
- GET /api/projects (list with pagination)
- GET /api/projects/:slug (single project)
- GET /api/groups (list with pagination)
- GET /api/groups/:slug (single group)
- GET /api/learning (list with pagination)
- GET /api/learning/:slug (single resource)

Requirements:
- Follow REST best practices
- Pagination with limit/offset or cursor
- Include Link headers for pagination
- Write OpenAPI/Swagger spec file
- Consider rate limiting
- Use SITE_URL for any absolute URLs in responses

title: Create Learning content type
description:
Implement the Learning content type for educational institutions.

## Database:
- learning table with type enum (university, college, bootcamp, online, other)

## Routes:
- /learning - list all learning resources
- /learning/:slug - individual institution page

## Admin:
- /manage/learning - CRUD operations

## Examples:
- Memorial University (Computer Science)
- College of the North Atlantic
- Keyin College
- Get Coding
- Online resources/courses

## Features:
- Program descriptions in markdown
- Type categorization
- External links
- Show affiliated people, events via [[reference]] system
close_reason: Created content type with public and admin routes

title: Create dedicated calendar page with setup instructions
description:
Create a page at /calendar that:
- Explains what iCal/ICS calendar subscriptions are
- Provides easy copy-to-clipboard button for the calendar URL
- Includes setup instructions for popular calendar apps (Google Calendar, Apple Calendar, Outlook)
- Shows the calendar URL using SITE_URL env var for canonical URLs
- Maybe shows a preview of upcoming events

title: Add markdown export feature
description:
Add ability to export the entire site content as a zip file of markdown files:
- Each content type in its own folder (companies/, events/, news/, etc.)
- Use slugs for filenames (e.g., companies/colab.md)
- Include frontmatter with metadata (title, dates, etc.)
- Reference images using canonical URLs (SITE_URL env var), not local paths
- Do NOT include actual image files in the export
- Can be a public endpoint or admin-only (public is fine)

title: Create People content type
description:
Implement the People content type for community members.

## Database:
- people table with bio, social links, avatar

## Routes:
- /people - list/directory of people
- /people/:slug - individual profile page

## Admin:
- /manage/people - CRUD operations

## Features:
- Markdown bio
- Avatar image
- Social links (twitter, github, linkedin, website)
- Show affiliations: companies worked at, groups member of, events spoken at, etc.
- All via [[reference]] system (bidirectional)
close_reason: Created content type with public and admin routes

title: Create public site navigation and homepage
description:
Update the public-facing site with navigation to all content types.

## Homepage:
- Keep the artsy header with SVG
- Featured/recent content from each type
- Quick links to each section

## Navigation:
- Minimal nav bar or menu
- Links to: Events, Companies, Groups, Learning, People, News, Jobs
- Subscribe links (RSS, iCal)

## Section Landing Pages:
- Each content type gets a list/grid view
- Filtering/search within sections
- Consistent card components
close_reason: Updated PublicLayout with navigation to all content types, homepage ready for content

title: Create admin projects routes (list, new, edit, delete)
Fix comment section header text
description:
Comment sections currently say 'Leave Feedback' which is incorrect terminology. Change to show:
- 'No Comments' (when empty, no private)
- '1 Comment' (singular)
- '5 Comments' (plural)
- 'No Comments (2 Private)' (when only private comments exist)
- '10 Comments (5 Private)' (showing private count in parentheses)

Remove any 'Leave Feedback' or similar wording.

title: Refactor Events to unified content pattern
description:
Update the existing Events system to match the new unified content pattern.

## Changes:
- Add slug field to events
- Update routes to use /events/:slug instead of relying on ID
- Add [[reference]] support in event descriptions
- Ensure events can link to companies, groups, people, learning institutions
- Update admin UI to match new patterns

## Keep:
- Multiple dates per event
- iCal feed (/calendar.ics)
- Cover/icon images
close_reason: Refactored events to unified content pattern with slug-based URLs and [[reference]] support

title: siliconharbour.dev Content Platform Expansion
description:
Transform the events-only site into a comprehensive St. John's tech community hub.

## Content Types
- Events (existing)
- Companies - local tech companies
- Groups - meetups, communities, organizations  
- Learning - educational institutions (MUN, CNA, Keyin, Get Coding, etc.)
- People - tech community members
- News - announcements, articles
- Jobs - employment opportunities

## Core Features
- Markdown-first content authoring
- [[reference]] linking system (Obsidian-style) for cross-referencing entities
- RSS feeds per content type + combined 'all' feed
- iCal feeds for events
- Affiliations: Companies/People/Learning can be linked to Events, News can reference any entity

## Technical Approach
- Drizzle ORM with SQLite
- Raw markdown storage (no WYSIWYG)
- Bidirectional link resolution
close_reason: Completed full content platform implementation with all content types, admin interfaces, and public navigation

Create a consistent admin interface for managing all content types.

## Layout:

## Navigation:

title: Fix button hover states - text becomes unreadable
description: When hovering over buttons, the text color changes to match the button background, making it unreadable. Ensure proper contrast is maintained on hover states across all buttons.

title: Design unified content schema
description:
Design the database schema for all content types with a unified approach.

## Tables to create:
- companies (id, slug, name, description, website, logo, location, founded, etc.)
- groups (id, slug, name, description, website, logo, meetup_frequency, etc.)
- learning (id, slug, name, description, website, logo, type enum: university/college/bootcamp/online)
- people (id, slug, name, bio, website, avatar, social_links json)
- news (id, slug, title, content, published_at, author)
- jobs (id, slug, title, description, company_id, location, remote, salary_range, posted_at, expires_at)

## Common patterns:
- All content has: id, slug, markdown content, created_at, updated_at
- All content can have: external_link, cover_image, icon_image
- Consider a polymorphic 'references' table for [[link]] relationships

## Considerations:
- Slugs for URL-friendly identifiers
- Markdown content stored as text
- References extracted and stored for bidirectional linking
close_reason: Schema designed and pushed to database. Added: companies, groups, learning, people, news, jobs tables. Added references table for [[link]] system with indexes. Added slug field to events.

title: Create GalleryUpload component for admin
Create public projects routes (list and detail)
Improve 'Referenced by' sections with type-specific layouts
description:
Currently 'Referenced by' sections on detail pages (companies, people, etc.) show a generic list when other content references them via [[links]]. Instead, display content in type-specific layouts matching the homepage style:
- News articles: show as news cards with cover image, date, excerpt
- Jobs: show as job listings with company, location, remote badge
- People: show as people cards with avatar
- Events: show as event cards with date/time
- Companies: show as company cards with logo
- Projects: show as project cards with logo

Reference the existing homepage components for consistent styling.

title: Update homepage with sections for all entities
Implement [[reference]] linking system
description:
Create a system for Obsidian-style [[reference]] links in markdown content.

## Requirements:
- Parse markdown content for [[EntityName]] patterns
- Store references in a dedicated table (source_type, source_id, target_type, target_id)
- Resolve references to actual entities by name/slug
- Support bidirectional queries (what links to X, what does X link to)
- Render [[references]] as clickable links in the UI

## Implementation:
1. Create 'references' table
2. Create parser utility to extract [[references]] from markdown
3. Create resolver to match references to entities
4. Hook into content save to update references
5. Create query helpers for bidirectional lookups
6. Create markdown renderer component that converts [[ref]] to links
close_reason: Implemented [[reference]] linking system: parser to extract refs from markdown, resolver to match refs to entities, CRUD helpers for references table, RichMarkdown component for rendering, bidirectional lookup queries, slug generation utility, and updated events to use slugs and sync references.
